1#ifndef UVW_DNS_INCLUDE_H
2#define UVW_DNS_INCLUDE_H
3
4
5#include <utility>
6#include <memory>
7#include <string>
8#include <uv.h>
9#include "request.hpp"
10#include "util.h"
11#include "loop.h"
12
13
14namespace uvw {
15
16
17/**
18 * @brief AddrInfoEvent event.
19 *
20 * It will be emitted by GetAddrInfoReq according with its functionalities.
21 */
22struct AddrInfoEvent {
23 using Deleter = void(*)(addrinfo *);
24
25 AddrInfoEvent(std::unique_ptr<addrinfo, Deleter> addr);
26
27 /**
28 * @brief An initialized instance of `addrinfo`.
29 *
30 * See [getaddrinfo](http://linux.die.net/man/3/getaddrinfo) for further
31 * details.
32 */
33 std::unique_ptr<addrinfo, Deleter> data;
34};
35
36
37/**
38 * @brief NameInfoEvent event.
39 *
40 * It will be emitted by GetNameInfoReq according with its functionalities.
41 */
42struct NameInfoEvent {
43 NameInfoEvent(const char *host, const char *serv);
44
45 /**
46 * @brief A valid hostname.
47 *
48 * See [getnameinfo](http://linux.die.net/man/3/getnameinfo) for further
49 * details.
50 */
51 const char * hostname;
52
53 /**
54 * @brief A valid service name.
55 *
56 * See [getnameinfo](http://linux.die.net/man/3/getnameinfo) for further
57 * details.
58 */
59 const char * service;
60};
61
62
63/**
64 * @brief The GetAddrInfoReq request.
65 *
66 * Wrapper for [getaddrinfo](http://linux.die.net/man/3/getaddrinfo).<br/>
67 * It offers either asynchronous and synchronous access methods.
68 *
69 * To create a `GetAddrInfoReq` through a `Loop`, no arguments are required.
70 */
71class GetAddrInfoReq final: public Request<GetAddrInfoReq, uv_getaddrinfo_t> {
72 static void addrInfoCallback(uv_getaddrinfo_t *req, int status, addrinfo *res);
73 void nodeAddrInfo(const char *node, const char *service, addrinfo *hints = nullptr);
74 auto nodeAddrInfoSync(const char *node, const char *service, addrinfo *hints = nullptr);
75
76public:
77 using Deleter = void(*)(addrinfo *);
78
79 using Request::Request;
80
81 /**
82 * @brief Async [getaddrinfo](http://linux.die.net/man/3/getaddrinfo).
83 * @param node Either a numerical network address or a network hostname.
84 * @param hints Optional `addrinfo` data structure with additional address
85 * type constraints.
86 */
87 void nodeAddrInfo(std::string node, addrinfo *hints = nullptr);
88
89 /**
90 * @brief Sync [getaddrinfo](http://linux.die.net/man/3/getaddrinfo).
91 *
92 * @param node Either a numerical network address or a network hostname.
93 * @param hints Optional `addrinfo` data structure with additional address
94 * type constraints.
95 *
96 * @return A `std::pair` composed as it follows:
97 * * A boolean value that is true in case of success, false otherwise.
98 * * A `std::unique_ptr<addrinfo, Deleter>` containing the data requested.
99 */
100 std::pair<bool, std::unique_ptr<addrinfo, Deleter>> nodeAddrInfoSync(std::string node, addrinfo *hints = nullptr);
101
102 /**
103 * @brief Async [getaddrinfo](http://linux.die.net/man/3/getaddrinfo).
104 * @param service Either a service name or a port number as a string.
105 * @param hints Optional `addrinfo` data structure with additional address
106 * type constraints.
107 */
108 void serviceAddrInfo(std::string service, addrinfo *hints = nullptr);
109
110 /**
111 * @brief Sync [getaddrinfo](http://linux.die.net/man/3/getaddrinfo).
112 *
113 * @param service Either a service name or a port number as a string.
114 * @param hints Optional `addrinfo` data structure with additional address
115 * type constraints.
116 *
117 * @return A `std::pair` composed as it follows:
118 * * A boolean value that is true in case of success, false otherwise.
119 * * A `std::unique_ptr<addrinfo, Deleter>` containing the data requested.
120 */
121 std::pair<bool, std::unique_ptr<addrinfo, Deleter>> serviceAddrInfoSync(std::string service, addrinfo *hints = nullptr);
122
123 /**
124 * @brief Async [getaddrinfo](http://linux.die.net/man/3/getaddrinfo).
125 * @param node Either a numerical network address or a network hostname.
126 * @param service Either a service name or a port number as a string.
127 * @param hints Optional `addrinfo` data structure with additional address
128 * type constraints.
129 */
130 void addrInfo(std::string node, std::string service, addrinfo *hints = nullptr);
131
132 /**
133 * @brief Sync [getaddrinfo](http://linux.die.net/man/3/getaddrinfo).
134 *
135 * @param node Either a numerical network address or a network hostname.
136 * @param service Either a service name or a port number as a string.
137 * @param hints Optional `addrinfo` data structure with additional address
138 * type constraints.
139 *
140 * @return A `std::pair` composed as it follows:
141 * * A boolean value that is true in case of success, false otherwise.
142 * * A `std::unique_ptr<addrinfo, Deleter>` containing the data requested.
143 */
144 std::pair<bool, std::unique_ptr<addrinfo, Deleter>> addrInfoSync(std::string node, std::string service, addrinfo *hints = nullptr);
145};
146
147
148/**
149 * @brief The GetNameInfoReq request.
150 *
151 * Wrapper for [getnameinfo](http://linux.die.net/man/3/getnameinfo).<br/>
152 * It offers either asynchronous and synchronous access methods.
153 *
154 * To create a `GetNameInfoReq` through a `Loop`, no arguments are required.
155 */
156class GetNameInfoReq final: public Request<GetNameInfoReq, uv_getnameinfo_t> {
157 static void nameInfoCallback(uv_getnameinfo_t *req, int status, const char *hostname, const char *service);
158
159public:
160 using Request::Request;
161
162 /**
163 * @brief Async [getnameinfo](http://linux.die.net/man/3/getnameinfo).
164 * @param addr Initialized `sockaddr_in` or `sockaddr_in6` data structure.
165 * @param flags Optional flags that modify the behavior of `getnameinfo`.
166 */
167 void nameInfo(const sockaddr &addr, int flags = 0);
168
169 /**
170 * @brief Async [getnameinfo](http://linux.die.net/man/3/getnameinfo).
171 * @param ip A valid IP address.
172 * @param port A valid port number.
173 * @param flags Optional flags that modify the behavior of `getnameinfo`.
174 */
175 template<typename I = IPv4>
176 void nameInfo(std::string ip, unsigned int port, int flags = 0);
177
178 /**
179 * @brief Async [getnameinfo](http://linux.die.net/man/3/getnameinfo).
180 * @param addr A valid instance of Addr.
181 * @param flags Optional flags that modify the behavior of `getnameinfo`.
182 */
183 template<typename I = IPv4>
184 void nameInfo(Addr addr, int flags = 0);
185
186 /**
187 * @brief Sync [getnameinfo](http://linux.die.net/man/3/getnameinfo).
188 *
189 * @param addr Initialized `sockaddr_in` or `sockaddr_in6` data structure.
190 * @param flags Optional flags that modify the behavior of `getnameinfo`.
191 *
192 * @return A `std::pair` composed as it follows:
193 * * A boolean value that is true in case of success, false otherwise.
194 * * A `std::pair` composed as it follows:
195 * * A `const char *` containing a valid hostname.
196 * * A `const char *` containing a valid service name.
197 */
198 std::pair<bool, std::pair<const char *, const char *>> nameInfoSync(const sockaddr &addr, int flags = 0);
199
200 /**
201 * @brief Sync [getnameinfo](http://linux.die.net/man/3/getnameinfo).
202 *
203 * @param ip A valid IP address.
204 * @param port A valid port number.
205 * @param flags Optional flags that modify the behavior of `getnameinfo`.
206 *
207 * @return A `std::pair` composed as it follows:
208 * * A boolean value that is true in case of success, false otherwise.
209 * * A `std::pair` composed as it follows:
210 * * A `const char *` containing a valid hostname.
211 * * A `const char *` containing a valid service name.
212 */
213 template<typename I = IPv4>
214 std::pair<bool, std::pair<const char *, const char *>> nameInfoSync(std::string ip, unsigned int port, int flags = 0);
215
216 /**
217 * @brief Sync [getnameinfo](http://linux.die.net/man/3/getnameinfo).
218 *
219 * @param addr A valid instance of Addr.
220 * @param flags Optional flags that modify the behavior of `getnameinfo`.
221 *
222 * @return A `std::pair` composed as it follows:
223 * * A boolean value that is true in case of success, false otherwise.
224 * * A `std::pair` composed as it follows:
225 * * A `const char *` containing a valid hostname.
226 * * A `const char *` containing a valid service name.
227 */
228 template<typename I = IPv4>
229 std::pair<bool, std::pair<const char *, const char *>> nameInfoSync(Addr addr, int flags = 0);
230};
231
232
233/**
234 * @cond TURN_OFF_DOXYGEN
235 * Internal details not to be documented.
236 */
237
238
239// (extern) explicit instantiations
240
241extern template void GetNameInfoReq::nameInfo<IPv4>(std::string ip, unsigned int port, int flags);
242extern template void GetNameInfoReq::nameInfo<IPv6>(std::string ip, unsigned int port, int flags);
243
244extern template void GetNameInfoReq::nameInfo<IPv4>(Addr addr, int flags);
245extern template void GetNameInfoReq::nameInfo<IPv6>(Addr addr, int flags);
246
247extern template std::pair<bool, std::pair<const char *, const char *>> GetNameInfoReq::nameInfoSync<IPv4>(std::string ip, unsigned int port, int flags);
248extern template std::pair<bool, std::pair<const char *, const char *>> GetNameInfoReq::nameInfoSync<IPv6>(std::string ip, unsigned int port, int flags);
249
250extern template std::pair<bool, std::pair<const char *, const char *>> GetNameInfoReq::nameInfoSync<IPv4>(Addr addr, int flags);
251extern template std::pair<bool, std::pair<const char *, const char *>> GetNameInfoReq::nameInfoSync<IPv6>(Addr addr, int flags);
252
253
254/**
255 * Internal details not to be documented.
256 * @endcond

260}
